item.title: Leah add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "From the crooked timber of humanity, a straight board cannot be hewn." -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Leah add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "Jeder für sich und Gott gegen alle" -- Werner Herzog

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tadeusz Borowski
item.description: "There can be no beauty if it is paid for by human injustice, nor truth that passes over injustice in silence, nor moral virtue that condones it." -- Tadeusz Borowski

item.title: Leah add a quote by Tadeusz Borowski
item.description: "The world is ruled by neither justice nor morality; crime is not punished nor virtue rewarded, one is forgotten as quickly as the other. The world is ruled by power and power is obtained with money. To work is senseless, because money cannot be obtained through work, but through exploitation of others. And if we cannot exploit as much as we wish, at least let us work as little as we can. Moral duty? We believe neither in the morality of man nor in the morality of systems. [p. 168]" -- Tadeusz Borowski

item.title: Leah add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "It did not really matter what we expected from life, but rather what life expected from us. We needed to stop asking about the meaning of life, and instead to think of ourselves as those who were being questioned by life—daily and hourly. Our answer must consist, not in talk and meditation, but in right action and in right conduct. Life ultimately means taking the responsibility to find the right answer to its problems and to fulfill the tasks which it constantly sets for each individual." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jiri Weil
item.description: "[To be a master] means that he must renounce everything personal, that he must be alone, that he must have no friends, that he must be inscrutable and inaccessible even at home among his family, even at parties and dinners. All that remains for him is music; it always helps when he feels tired; it offers peace and contentment; the tensions of the day melt away in it. He remembers listening to Beethoven's Fourth after the Night of the Long Knives, remembers how it gave him strength to carry on, to continue interrogating enemies and beating confessions out of them. The music cleansed everything that time, even the blood." -- Jiri Weil

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jiri Weil
item.description: "The minister said, "Music in stone," and truly this phrase, bandied about by authors of art books, described Prague well. The city was, indeed, steeped in music and brought into harmony by it. " -- Jiri Weil

item.title: Leah add a quote by Frederico Fellini
item.description: "Ricordati che è un film comico. ['Remember, this a comedy']" -- Frederico Fellini

item.title: Leah add a quote by Ernst Jünger
item.description: "Habent sua fata libelli et balli [Books and bullets have their own destinies]" -- Ernst Jünger

item.title: Leah add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Einmal ist keinmal, says Tomas to himself. What happens but once, says the German adage, might as well not have happened at all. If we have only one life to live, we might as well not have lived at all." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Leah add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "I live, which is the main point." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Leah add a quote by Henri J.M. Nouwen
item.description: "Let us not underestimate how hard it is to be compassionate. Compassion is hard because it requires the inner disposition to go with others to place where they are weak, vulnerable, lonely, and broken. But this is not our spontaneous response to suffering. What we desire most is to do away with suffering by fleeing from it or finding a quick cure for it." -- Henri J.M. Nouwen

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pema Chödrön
item.description: "Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It's a relationship between equals. Only when we know our own darkness well can we be present with the darkness of others. Compassion becomes real when we recognize our shared humanity." -- Pema Chödrön

item.title: Leah add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Compassion is the radicalism of our time." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Leah add a quote by Henri J.M. Nouwen
item.description: "Compassion asks us to go where it hurts, to enter into the places of pain, to share in brokenness, fear, confusion, and anguish. Compassion challenges us to cry out with those in misery, to mourn with those who are lonely, to weep with those in tears. Compassion requires us to be weak with the weak, vulnerable with the vulnerable, and powerless with the powerless. Compassion means full immersion in the condition of being human." -- Henri J.M. Nouwen

item.title: Leah add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "I have written it before and am not ashamed to write it again. Without Wodehouse I am not sure that I would be a tenth of what I am today -- whatever that may be. In my teenage years, his writings awoke me to the possibilities of language. His rhythms, tropes, tricks and mannerisms are deep within me. But more than that, he taught me something about good nature. It is enough to be benign, to be gentle, to be funny, to be kind." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Leah add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You are good. But it is not enough just to be good. You must be good for something. You must contribute good to the world. The world must be a better place for your presence. And the good that is in you must be spread to others… In this world so filled with problems, so constantly threatened by dark and evil challenges, you can and must rise above mediocrity, above indifference. You can become involved and speak with a strong voice for that which is right." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Leah add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "Reading, his therapist had suggested, had likely been his first drug." -- William Gibson

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I love you’ means that I accept you for the person that you are, and that I do not wish to change you into someone else. It means that I will love you and stand by you even through the worst of times. It means loving you even when you’re in a bad mood, or too tired to do the things I want to do. It means loving you when you’re down, not just when you’re fun to be with. ‘I love you’ means that I know your deepest secrets and do not judge you for them, asking in return that you do not judge me for mine. It means that I care enough to fight for what we have and that I love you enough not to let go. It means thinking of you, dreaming of you, wanting and needing you constantly, and hoping you feel the same way for me" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Leah add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I hope you never love anything as much as I love you." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "my feet will want to walk to where you are sleeping but I shall go on living." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "In this part of the story I am the one who dies, the only one, and I will die of love because I love you, because I love you, Love, in fire and in blood." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Leah add a quote by Meridel Le Sueur
item.description: "The history of an oppressed people is hidden in the lies and the agreed myth of its conquerors." -- Meridel Le Sueur

item.title: Leah add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Once, an elderly general practitioner consulted me because of his severe depression. He could not overcome the loss of his wife who had died two years before and whom he had loved above all else. Now, how can I help him? What should I tell him? Well, I refrained from telling him anything but instead confronted him with the question, “What would have happened, Doctor, if you had died first, and your wife would have had to survive you?” “Oh,” he said, “for her this would have been terrible; how she would have suffered!” Whereupon I replied, “You see, Doctor, such a suffering has been spared her, and it was you who have spared her this suffering — to be sure, at the price that now you have to survive and mourn her.” He said no word but shook my hand and calmly left my office. In some way, suffering ceases to be suffering at the moment it finds a meaning, such as the meaning of a sacrifice." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda
